message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), which can be prevented with beta-blocker propranolol that can decrease the consolidation of traumatic memories. Prazosin can help with nightmares and sleep disturbance, but not prevention. Sertraline is often used to treat PTSD, but not prevent it. Zolpidem is a sleep aid and would not prevent PTSD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and among the options, only Propranolol, a beta-blocker, has been shown to potentially prevent PTSD if given soon after trauma exposure. Prazosin is used to treat nightmares associated with PTSD, Sertraline is an antidepressant that can be used for PTSD treatment, and Zolpidem is a sleep aid that would not address the underlying cause of the patient's insomnia.
